title: FizzBuzz
description: Write a program that prints numbers from 1 to 20. For multiples of 3 print 'Fizz' instead of the number, for multiples of 5 print 'Buzz'. For numbers which are multiples of both 3 and 5 print 'FizzBuzz'.
rubric: Correctness (70): Must print exactly the expected output for 1-20, including edge case 15 as FizzBuzz.\nStyle (20): Use clear variable names and proper indentation.\nEfficiency (10): Single loop, no redundant conditions.

title: Palindrome Check
description: Write a function isPalindrome(str) that returns true if the input string reads the same forwards and backwards (ignore case, spaces, punctuation). Example: 'A man, a plan, a canal: Panama' â†’ true.
rubric: Correctness (80): Must handle case, spaces, punctuation correctly. Edge cases: empty string, single char, numbers.\nStyle (15): Clean function, no global variables.\nEfficiency (5): O(n) time, single pass.
expected_input:
racecar
A man a plan a canal panama
12321
hello

title: Two Sum
description: Given a list of integers nums and an integer target, return indices of the two numbers such that they add up to target. You may assume that each input would have exactly one solution, and you may not use the same element twice.
rubric: Correctness (75): Must return correct indices. Handle edge cases: len(nums)=2, negative numbers.\nStyle (15): Use meaningful variable names.\nEfficiency (10): O(n) time using hash map.
